channel.title: Wrestle Daddies
channel.description:
Jake and Brett have been longtime friends, wrestling fans, and improvisers. They have decided to take their relationship one further by entering fatherhood together, but these aren't your regular baybays! We take your suggestions for wrestler names or wrestler gimmicks and nurture those ideas into fully grown wrestle children.
New Episodes every Thursday.
Brett and Jake are Toronto based improvisers, writers, and comedians, and founding members of Hot Garbage Players.

item.title: 071 – Enter CompuDong
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Brett, excuse me – Uncle Bic wasn’t kidding, Garytopia is in flames. Superheros are tangling with supervillians left and right. It is time for Jake to choose his superhero identity and for our brave team of heroes to begin their journey to reclaim the mayoral throne from the awful minotaur Gary Meatman.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 070 – Revengers
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
A lot can happen when you miss a week… Jake has been missing ever since he recorded his radio show two weeks ago. In the meantime – Everything has changed. Gary World has become Gary Topia and Gary Meatman has come back to rule with an iron fist. There is only one group of ragtag superheroes who can stop him…

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 069 – Uncle Bort’s 69th Episode Spectacular
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Brett’s been planning a big surprise reunion for our 69th episode, but Jake is too busy getting ready for his big radio show guest spot with Ric Flair. Will Brett stand in the way of Jake’s dream/waking nightmare?

—

Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 068 – Fisticuffs Slamdown 3
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The moment you have all been waiting for… It’s finally here… you’ve been waiting a whole week for the third Fisticuffs Slamdown – well wait no longer. After the catastrophic ending to the last Fisticuffs Slamdown the Daddies decide to do the whole thing again a week later. Except we try to do the fastest Royal Rumble in history.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 067 – Fisticuffs Slamdown 2
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The moment you have all been waiting for… Fisticuffs Slamdown 2! The legally distinct Royal Rumble knockoff returns with some enhancements. 24 Women (and some fish) will compete for the Wrestle Daddies Women’s Championship (now the Google World Championship) surrounded by an electrified steel cage and a moat full of surly fish. Will Scarlett Charlotte Chode overcome the odds and defend her title? Or will a newcomer like Sister Sinister overthrow her? Tune in!

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 065- A Fish/Woman Based Promotion
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Wrestle Daddies are back home and back to their roots! Mostly. We wanted to do an entirely female promotion to shake things up… but then we remembered that we just hired a bunch of fishmen. So. Here we are. Also the Wu-Tang Clam is running wild!

—

Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 064 – Royalty Free, Under the Sea (with Chris Nyarady)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The Wrestle Daddies Summer Road Trip is winding to a close. Mostly out of necessity as their latest wrong turn has sent them to the bottom of the ocean – Atlantis. Luckily their recent business investments in Atlantis and their previous establishment of the Atlantean Championship has fostered a wrestling culture in the deep sea city. Unfortunately as their new fishy friend, Fin, points out – that’s about all it has fostered.

Also our special guest this week has a brand new show here on Station Zed! Do you like James Bond? Do you like the occasional martini or ten? Check out Boozing & Bonding, the new podcast where Chris and Keegan pair drinks with James Bond films and review them while they descend into drunkenness. Here on Station Zed.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Featuring – Chris Nyarady
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.description:

item.title: 060 – For Legal Purposes (with Brian Edwards)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
As the summer vacation continues the Wrestle Daddies go south… deep south to meet the perfect southern Gentleman – Cash Debonair. Now for legal purposes we can’t go into too much information about his wrestling promotion, but we can say that he has won many awards for his debutantes. I mean wrestlers. Damn it.

—

item.title: 059 – Knock Knock Knocking on Heaven’s Door (with Sam Adams)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Brett falls asleep at the wheel and the Daddies end up at the Dartmouth Sportsplex in Nova Scotia where they meet bona fide ring veteran The Dartmouth Door Dasher, one of the world’s greatest players of Nicky Nicky Nine Doors. Forced into an early retirement from a mysterious scandal, Triple D lures children into the Sportsplex with french fries to put on Rumble Jumbles. Featuring such future stars as Gerald the Dog Faced Boy and Raowler. Come check out one of the most emotional matches you have ever had the pleasure of smelling.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Guest Host – Sam Adams
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 058 – Inside Out Danny Goes To Washington (with Michael Mongiardi)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Things get surgical as the Wrestle Daddies continue their Summer Education tour… We find ourselves in rural Ontario at Inside Out Danny’s controversial promotion – Inside Out Wrestling, where all of the wrestlers are inside out. Worlds collide as some classic Wrestle Daddies stars go up against the likes of Upside Down Margaret and one of our Wrestle Children has their life changed forever…

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Guest Host – Michael Mongiardi
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 057 – Summer School is in Session (with Lance Byrd)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The Wrestle Daddies start their cross-country summer tour as they seek out the brightest minds of the wrestling business to study under. First stop – Brett’s hotel. Brett grabbed Sid Crosby, a limo driver from the hotel who has an edgy guerrilla wrestling promotion with some major history – Wrestling Company (Going For a Long Time). And no he is not that Sid Crosby, but he’d be a very good wrestler too.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Guest Host – Lance Byrd
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 056 – Eighty Pounds of Gold
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
After returning from E3 the Daddies pose a tough question – have they become out of touch with wrestling? How do they bring back their hardcore wrestling fans? Why with a new and utterly confusing championship title of course! Tune in as the first ever ‘Atlantean Championship. Including some new listener suggestions such as Mort the Tort and Wind Turbines!

item.title: 053 – A Tournament Just For You
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Muscleman Poundtown pounds on ahead with full coverage of the Tournament Just For You! The winner will earn the right to face three other men for the Wrestle Daddies Championship. Yes that’s right, the prize for beating 15 other wrestlers is the right to fight three more! Some classic first round match ups scheduled include – Hulk Hogan vs Mr. Dressup, Barack Obama vs Shark Boy Sr and of course the much anticipated clash of Price is Right Hosts: J.T. Street vs Drew Carey.

item.title: 052 – Muscleman Poundtown
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
In our Season Six Premiere, Brett and Jake finally bury the hatchet in order to create a brand new wrestling sensation – Muscleman Poundtown. We need a new start, and what better way to do that then to draft an entire new company?

—

item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Our one year anniversary pay per view, it’s Daddyversary, baybay! Brett and our old friend the Time Wizard have bent the laws of our universe to bring you the grandest wrestling pay per view in history. In fact we go all the way back to the year 2005 for a card stacked to the brim. John Lennon and Paul McCartney take on Pomp and Circumstance, Goku fights Freiza but it’s all about that main event – Daddy v Daddy II.

—

Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 042 – A War of 1812 No Disqualification Interpretative Dance (with Craig Mazerolle)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
O Canada! The Daddies are finally back home… but no rest for the wicked. Ace Lawyer Craig Mazerolle and his friend Can Con have threatened to pull all of Wrestle Daddies sweet sweet grant funding unless they can make the show more Canadian. So strap on your hockey bag and douse your chest hair with sweet, sticky maple syrup as we embrace our Roots (TM) and get all Canuck on y’all.

Also a special pitch for Station Zed’s new podcast ‘Springfield: The Later Years’, a podcast where Craig and Pat (of The Dust Off) are two diehard Simpsons fans forced (by themselves) to dive into the controversial later seasons of the show they hold so dear. They already have a slew of episodes waiting just for you right here.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Guest Host – Craig Mazerolle
Special Cameo – Pat Brennan
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

Steele and Level 37 Feng Shui Master JOHn, decide to evolve the very IDEA of Wrestling in their new show – “Beyond Wrestling”. Listen in horror as Martin, Steele and JOHn break apart everything you love… but listen in unbridled pleasure as they build it up again. — Hosted by Jake Martin, Dylan Sealy and Lucas Martin Cut by Jake Martin Logo by Scott Latimer Original Music by Dylan Sealy

item.title: 032 – Bort Bone’s Info War(games)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
After being fired from Wrestle Daddies, the shackles have been taken off ol’ Uncle Bort and he is MIFFED! Bort is here to expound some truths.

A brand new show from the former Wrestle Daddy.

—
Host and Cut by Brett Loughery
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 031 – My Dinner With Lauren (with Alexa Higgins)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The moment we have been dreading. Food Network CEO Lauren Graham has come over to Brett’s house for dinner and to meet his lovely family. It would be a nice, cozy winter evening if not for the fact that Ms. Graham has made it very clear that at the end of the night one of the Daddies will be FIRED. One thing is for sure, we will always remember our dinner with Lauren.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Guest Host: Alexa Higgins
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.description:
Christmas comes early for all the good Wrestle Children as Brett and Jake transform their network mandated ‘Freakshow!’ pay per view into the festive ’12 Matches of Christmas’. Listen in by that warm glowing fire as special guests from episodes past come back for the holiday good time feelings.

item.title: 029 – The Big Food Network in the Sky (with Alexa Higgins)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
The Reckoning has come for our Daddies as Food Network CEO Lauren Graham Cracker parachutes directly into Gary World wondering where their wrestling content has flown off to. Brett and Jake weave a complicated wicker basket of lies to convince Ms. Graham Cracker that, as the old Irish proverb goes, ‘Everything is Fine’.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Guest Host – Alexa Higgins
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band
Additional Music – Title(what comes after “Music:”) by Kevin MacLeod

item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Roles are reversed as Jake becomes enchanted with Gary World and finds a heap of suggestions for new attractions. Meanwhile, Brett is off to Asia to contract a new work force for the theme park – New Japan Pro Wrestling’s Young Lions. Let’s hope Food Network doesn’t find out we started a new show!

—

item.title: 027 – Blind Uncle Bort’s Underground Labyrinth
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Altavista’s brand new streaming service is off to a bombastic start as Brett is left to build the start of an amusement park by himself. Our co-hosts reunite after weeks of contract negotiations to start from square one yet again… luckily Brett’s got a pocket full of wrestlers and Jake has a lucrative deal with Altavista! item.title: 025 – Wrestle Daddies: A Retrospective
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
If you have never listened to an episode of Wrestle Daddies… this would be the perfect chance to start! After having no contact with Brett since he quit the show, we received this tape in the mail. A full retrospective of Wrestle Daddies greatest moments… and what appears to be an apology.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band
—

item.description:
The Merge! 11 wrestlers have defied the odds and made it to the merge in this season of Wrestle Daddies Survivor. Stone Cold Steve Austin, Sasha Banks, Bayley, Brian Pillman, Triple H, HBK, CM Punk, Asuka, The Miz, Jake the Snake Roberts and your own Wrestle Daddy Jake have clawed their way to the top. Now to see who receives he prestigious Wrestle Daddies title!

item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Our season of Survivor rolls on and the hidden immunity idols flow freely. Meanwhile, Hulk Hogan declaring himself team captain has ruffled a few feathers… including a Mr. Stone Cold Steve Austin. We sprint towards the merge as all of your favourite wrestlers (and Jake) battle it out for that sweet prize of our title belt. And a million dollars in Nazi Gold.

—

item.title: 022 – “Survivor” Series Part One
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
39 Days. 18 Wrestlers. 1 Survivor. Under the guidance of former champion Jeff Probst (aka El Totino) we bring a full season of Wrestle Daddies Survivor to the Food Network! A tribe of Heels, a tribe of Tweeners and a tribe of Faces compete for the coveted Wrestle Daddies Championship on the sunny beaches of Letzay, Fiji. See all your favourite stars compete! Shawn Michaels! CM Punk! The Hamburglar! All the greats are here!

—

Logo by Scott Latimer

item.description:
Rob Van Dam has left us with the love triangle of Dave Meltzer, Vince Russo and Jim Cornette in the middle of our ring. Brett’s obsession with Survivor threatens to swallow the company. The only solution is to bring in a real, Blue Collar American to save Wrestle Daddies: Career Day – Alexander Rusev.

item.title: 016 – Fisticuffs Slamdown!
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Ladies and Gentlemen, welcome to the 1st ever Wrestle Daddies: Fisticuffs Slamdown! In this electrifying one hour special, the Daddies submit your suggestions to a grueling Fisticuffs Slamdown, an event that our legal team insisted we say is ‘similar but legally distinct from the Royal Rumble’. One Vacant Title, Two Dozen Men, Three Dollars will get you a ballpark footlong at the arena. Some new stars include Papa Squat and The Human Spike Pit, Simon Portnoy.

—

Hosted and Cut by Brett Loughery and Jake Martin
Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

item.title: 014 – Laser Baby: The Buzz Hardcastle Story, Part Two (with Matt Nadeau)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Episode 14 – Laser Baby: The Buzz Hardcastle Story, Part Two (with Matt Nadeau)

The Wrestle Daddies and their favourite son trek through the plains, jungles, mountains, and caves of Margaritaville looking to complete their quest. Is it a rescue or a mission of vengeance? Will Brett and Jake’s friendship reach the boiling point? And will Buzz Hardcastle be able to find the power within to be a true hero when given the chance? Find out in this exciting conclusion of Season 2.

—

item.description:
Episode 13 – Laser Baby: The Buzz Hardcastle Story, Part One (with Matt Nadeau)

The Wrestle Daddies come face to face with one of their own creations as Buzz Hardcastle, Sexual Astronaut shows up at the Mobile Podcast Unit. Will Brett be able to reconcile with Buzz and Jake? Will Buzz ever find his nemesis? Will we see more wrestling? Find out in our two part season finale!

—

item.title: 012 – Alone On An Island
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Episode 12 – Alone On An Island

The Wrestle Daddies have been torn asunder… Brett has jettisoned himself from the Mobile Podcast Unit onto the surface of the planet and all Jake has to go off of for this week’s episode are a series of cryptic audio diaries. Will the mind link between the Daddies be enough to create a new wrestler? That’s right, we make wrestlers again…Tune in and find out!

—

Logo by Scott Latimer
Theme – ‘The Invincible Eagle’ by John Philip Sousa as performed by the United States Marine Band

Season Two Premiere! The Daddies try to get back to basics and turn the show into self-contained episodes…. and immediately fail. Episode 8 – Quarterly Report (with Lucas Martin)

REVERSE DRAFT SPECIAL! It’s time for a Reverse Draft here on Wrestle Daddies. Now I hear you, isn’t that just another word for layoffs? Well kind of. item.title: 005 – The Tuesday Afternoon Wars Begin (with Pat Brennan)
item.dc:creator: Wrestle Daddies
item.description:
Episode 5 – The Tuesday Afternoon Wars Begin

This is WAR. The Daddies have started a ratings war for the ages with their bitter rivals ‘The Price is Right’. They might need some help for this one… so they have called on their first Guest Daddy: Pat Brennan of ‘The Dust Off’! Experience in full audio glory the sounds of battle as Pat brings out his secret weapon – Old Dutch.

—

You can catch Pat Brennan on his show ‘The Dust Off’ at www.thedustoff.com

item.description:
Episode 4 – The Ballad of Hot Toddy

Oh no! Your dads are fighting over money again! Bort and Jake struggle with the responsibilities of parenting. The Murphy Parents try to get their kids back from their captors. We begin our journey to crown our first champion. And what is this guy in a poncho waiting for? Rain? All this and more, this week, on Wrestle Daddies.

—

Our Daddies are back to tussle over all genres of boys. Their multimedia empire continues to grow this week as we get to know a family that’s been through it all, make goofs with visual aides, frantically type in the background, and generally forget to make a wrestling show.

The Daddies book the very first episode of what will surely be the most successful wrestling company of all time – Grand Central Championship Station. Come see such suggested dynamos as ‘Needles’ Nic Stoakes, Soft Candy and Bad Breath Barry Brown light up New York’s Grand Central Station and undoubtedly mess up everyone’s commute to work.
